info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 08 at 9:26PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Is Possible through Tuesday Afternoon... .A surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds is expected through tonight following the cold front. Relative humidity will crash into the teens and lower 20s before rising back into the 20s overnight as temperatures fall. Winds will diminish a bit on Tuesday, but still remain strong enough to combine with continued dry air to return relative humidity below 20 percent by early afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY FOR THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS, AND DRYING FUELS, FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS EXCEPT THE BARRIER ISLAND... * AFFECTED AREA...All of Deep South Texas except the Barrier Island. * TIMING...Now through 6 PM Tuesday. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph tonight, then northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 66. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is possible through Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
